flawed_nl_solution:
She uses 7 x 2 = <<7*2=14>>14 gallons of water to clean the two cars.
She uses 14 - 11 = <<14-11=7>>7 gallons of water to water the plants.
The total gallons of water that she uses to clean the cars and to water the plants is 14 + 7 = <<14+7=21>>21.
Jan has 65 - 21 = <<65-21=44>>44 gallons of water remaining after cleaning the cars and watering the plants.
Jan uses 44 / 2 = <<44/2=22>>22 gallons of water to wash her plates and clothes.
